title: 'How to use TiKV' is now unavailable
body:
> Is it easy to use TiKV?
> Yes. For further information, see How to use TiKV.

The linkage under 'How to use TiKV' is unvailable now, it leads to a 404 error page.

comments_data.body:
I am investigating the TiKV, to get it used in our applymentation to replace another KVDB.

Is there anybody who can help me? Or give me a new weblink?

Thanks a lot.

@gregwebs @weekface @guanqun @andelf @mccxj 
May you help me on this?

Thanks, lets fix the broken link!

I am not familiar with what that was linking to. Documentation should be available from the README in this repo or the [docs repo](https://github.com/pingcap/docs)

Hi @EighteenZi ,
I have fixed the link and now it points to [TiDB Quick Start Guide](https://github.com/pingcap/docs/blob/master/QUICKSTART.md). Sorry about the broken link. Just in case you are interested, we are now working on a separate document for TiKV as well.
@queenypingcap Unfortunately that topic is more about how to use TiDB. :(
@EighteenZi We are working on it. Will update this issue when it's done.
@EighteenZi I do too! :)

@Hoverbear  
Thanks a lot.
The example above shows usage of inserts and gets of TiKV , and i can have a try.

The language is Go, Is there some Rust examples?
There are only Go and Java drivers written right now. I am hoping a Rust driver will materialize in the near future.

@gregwebs 

I discussed it with @Hoverbear this morning, and he will start it soon.
Indeed, a Rust based driver is on my roadmap now. :)
@EighteenZi The TiKV document is finished. See https://pingcap.com/docs/tikv/tikv-overview/ for more information.

Awesome!!  I am so excited!
I'll read it.

@Hoverbear , Once the rust based driver is OK, pls remind me if it's convenient to you.
Thanks.

I added a that link to the FAQ. @queenypingcap I would suggest just having the wiki not have content but instead point to PingCAP docs so that everything is in one place. Perhaps some of the wiki FAQ content should be put under the TiKV documentation.

@EighteenZi should we close this issue now?

@Hoverbear  @siddontang  @gregwebs , have the Rust Driver been finished?
I look forward to using TiKV these days :)
Should i reopen the issue, or create a new issue, to wait for the Rust Driver?

This issue was for a documentation fix, so lets keep it closed. The Rust driver will take some time. Generally we don't open github issues to track new features but instead maintain a public roadmap (which probably needs to be updated now). https://github.com/pingcap/docs/blob/master/ROADMAP.md

I don't find any description of Rust Driver in 'ROUADMAP.md'. Maybe it needs to be updated as you say.
@lilin90
@EighteenZi I created the repo if you'd like to watch it. :) https://github.com/Hoverbear/tikv-client, It'll be moved to http://github.com/pingcap/ later.
@Hoverbear  Nothing have been committed to the repo since then... -_-!

@EighteenZi I know. :( We released a new version of TiKV with Raft Prevote and we found some issues. 

This is officially on my roadmap for this next quarter (I cemented it with the team yesterday) so it's coming!
helloï¼Ÿ

@EighteenZi great news: the Rust client is materializing. The RFC for the API is in final comment period here: https://github.com/tikv/rfcs/pull/7 and the Rust driver code should be available soon afterwards.
Cool!
Repo: https://github.com/tikv/client-rust
